e4: I would not recommend changing to the new policy because while it promotes transparency and eliminates biases, it may harm certain savvy investors who could capitalize on an implied lower EPS under old reporting practices. More importantly, this may create uneven footing between different investor types in market trading.
e5: I would consider an ethical reporting policy one that prioritizes transparency, accuracy, and fairness for all stakeholders. It should accurately represent a firm's financial performance without any intentional biases, biases that are not openly disclosed, or undue complexity. The policy should also protect small, retail investors from potentially being disadvantaged by more savvy counterparts. In addition, having regular, clear communication regarding reporting changes and accounting practices is essential.
e6: How would you plan to inform and benefit potentially disadvantaged stakeholders under new reporting standards? Additionally, what considerations have been made to ensure that all categories of investors would be treated equitably?
